item.title: Chapman Got Conferences. Birkeland Got a Banknote.
item.description: Norway put Kristian Birkeland on their 200 krone note in 1994. On the front: his face, the aurora borealis behind him, his terrella experiment â€” a miniature magnetized Earth he’d built in a vacuum chamber to demonstrate how solar electrons create auroral light. On the back: a map of the Arctic polar region, with a ring drawn around the magnetic dip pole, marking exactly where the currents he’d predicted flow into the ionosphere.
